greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = the smallest positive integer such that a(n) *(2^n -2) is a multiple of n.
comment: This is not the same sequence as sequence A032742, where A032742(n) = the largest proper divisor of n. See A146077 for numbers n such that the sequences A032742 and A159353 differ.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: Array[Block[{k = 1}, While[! Divisible[k (2^# - 2), #], k++]; k] &, 84] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Oct 30 2017 *)
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Apr 11 2009
